title: Classic Auto Racing
description: Start your engines and race through memories of the greatest drivers and most thrilling moments in motorsport history!

questions.question: Which driver won the Indianapolis 500 a record four times, in 1961, 1964, 1967, and 1977?
Richard Petty, known as 'The King' of NASCAR, won the Daytona 500 how many times?
Which famous sports car race, held annually in France, is a 24-hour endurance event?
Mario Andretti won the Formula One World Championship in which year?
The Daytona 500, often called 'The Great American Race,' is held at a superspeedway in which state?
Which Argentine Formula One driver won five World Championships in the 1950s?
Dale Earnhardt Sr., known as 'The Intimidator,' drove which iconic car number throughout most of his NASCAR career?
Richard Petty won a record 200 NASCAR races during his career. What number was on his famous Plymouth and Dodge cars?
Which British Formula One driver won the World Championship in 1962 and 1968 before his tragic death in 1968?
The legendary rivalry between David Pearson and Richard Petty dominated which racing series in the 1960s and 1970s?
Which Scottish driver won three Formula One World Championships in 1969, 1971, and 1973?
The Indianapolis 500 traditionally takes place on which holiday weekend?
Which Austrian Formula One driver suffered severe burns in a crash at the 1976 German Grand Prix but remarkably returned to racing just six weeks later?
Ford's GT40 famously ended Ferrari's dominance at Le Mans by winning four consecutive years starting in what year?
Janet Guthrie made history in 1977 as the first woman to do what in auto racing?
